author: ryanleeschneider
content:
RE: `eth_call` and related RPCs: I wonder if we'd be better served by having two explicitly different RPCs for the two use cases (calling a static EVM function and seeing if a tx is executable).  See for example Peter's description of the heuristics that geth makes (https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/23027#issue-916923366) where it assumes if `gasPrice` is added then the user is trying to determine if their tx is executable.

While probably too late to change the behavior of `eth_call` perhaps `eth_multiCall` should be split into something like `eth_multiCallStatic` and `eth_multiCallExecutable` (horrible first pass names just to get the point across).
